intro: Urophyllum bataanense, commonly known as the Bataan flatleaf, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its broad, flat leaves and clusters of small white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within forest understories. It has been identified as a potential candidate for conservation due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity. Its botanical features make it an important subject for ecological and taxonomic studies in Southeast Asia.
